repnme.cdata!: Vietnam - Mekong Regional Health Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mekong Health Support
            Project for Vietnam were as follows: overall outcome was
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            and both the Bank and the Borrower performance were
            satisfactory. The important project lessons learned are: (i)
            the technical lessons learned of relevance for the World
            Bank and other countries work on universal health care; and
            (ii) the particular project design and implementation issues
            which have implications for the design of such projects.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Mekong Regional Health Support
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mekong Regional Health Support
            Project for Vietnam aims to improve health services in the
            Mekong region and to enhance access to and coverage of these
            services, especially for the poor through: (i) strengthening
            the health financing policy framework and increasing the
            financial accessibility of health services for the poor and
            near-poor; (ii) improving the availability and quality of
            curative care, including responsiveness to changing disease
            patterns; (iii) increasing the capacity of preventive health
            activities; and (iv) building the capacity of the health
            workforce. The recent Quality Assurance Group (QAG) review
            of the project in July 2010 pointed out that the project
            development objective (PDO) and intermediate result
            indicators were not adequately formulated to measure the
            achievement of the project with reasonable validity and
            accuracy. The initial set of indicators was considered as
            lacking focus on outcomes, not specific on quality dimension
            to be measured, and vaguely formulated on patient
            satisfaction. Following the QAG review, the project team
            conducted a review mission to revisit the PDO and
            indicators. It was agreed with the government counterparts
            to revise the project results Indicators so as to better
            measure project achievements.
